057/**
058 * Default implementation of a <a href="http://developers.facebook.com/docs/api">Facebook Graph API</a> client.
059 * 
060 * @author <a href="http://restfb.com">Mark Allen</a>
061 */
062public class DefaultFacebookClient extends BaseFacebookClient implements FacebookClient {
063  public static final String CLIENT_ID = "client_id";
064  public static final String APP_ID = "appId";
065  public static final String APP_SECRET = "appSecret";
066  public static final String SCOPE = "scope";
067  public static final String CANNOT_EXTRACT_ACCESS_TOKEN_MESSAGE = "Unable to extract access token from response.";
068  public static final String PARAM_CLIENT_SECRET = "client_secret";
069
070  public static final String CONNECTION = "connection";
071  public static final String CONNECTION_TYPE = "connectionType";
072  public static final String ALGORITHM = "algorithm";
073  /**
074   * Graph API access token.
075   */
076  protected String accessToken;
077
078  /**
079   * Graph API app secret.
080   */
081  private String appSecret;
082
083  /**
084   * facebook exception generator to convert Facebook error json into java exceptions
085   */
086  private FacebookExceptionGenerator graphFacebookExceptionGenerator;
087
088  /**
089   * holds the Facebook endpoint urls
090   */
091  private FacebookEndpoints facebookEndpointUrls = new FacebookEndpoints() {};
092
093  /**
094   * Reserved "multiple IDs" parameter name.
095   */
096  protected static final String IDS_PARAM_NAME = "ids";
097
098  /**
099   * Version of API endpoint.
100   */
101  protected Version apiVersion;
102
103  /**
104   * By default this is <code>false</code>, so real http DELETE is used
105   */
106  protected boolean httpDeleteFallback;
107
108  protected boolean accessTokenInHeader;
109
110  protected DefaultFacebookClient() {
111    this(Version.LATEST);
112  }
113
114  /**
115   * Creates a Facebook Graph API client with the given {@code apiVersion}.
116   * 
117   * @param apiVersion
118   *          Version of the api endpoint
119   */
120  public DefaultFacebookClient(Version apiVersion) {
121    this(null, null, new DefaultWebRequestor(), new DefaultJsonMapper(), apiVersion);
122  }
123
124  /**
125   * Creates a Facebook Graph API client with the given {@code accessToken}.
126   * 
127   * @param accessToken
128   *          A Facebook OAuth access token.
129   * @param apiVersion
130   *          Version of the api endpoint
131   * @since 1.6.14
132   */
133  public DefaultFacebookClient(String accessToken, Version apiVersion) {
134    this(accessToken, null, new DefaultWebRequestor(), new DefaultJsonMapper(), apiVersion);
135  }
136
137  /**
138   * Creates a Facebook Graph API client with the given {@code accessToken}.
139   * 
140   * @param accessToken
141   *          A Facebook OAuth access token.
142   * @param appSecret
143   *          A Facebook application secret.
144   * @param apiVersion
145   *          Version of the api endpoint
146   * @since 1.6.14
147   */
148  public DefaultFacebookClient(String accessToken, String appSecret, Version apiVersion) {
149    this(accessToken, appSecret, new DefaultWebRequestor(), new DefaultJsonMapper(), apiVersion);
150  }
151
152  /**
153   * Creates a Facebook Graph API client with the given {@code accessToken}.
154   * 
155   * @param accessToken
156   *          A Facebook OAuth access token.
157   * @param webRequestor
158   *          The {@link WebRequestor} implementation to use for sending requests to the API endpoint.
159   * @param jsonMapper
160   *          The {@link JsonMapper} implementation to use for mapping API response JSON to Java objects.
161   * @param apiVersion
162   *          Version of the api endpoint
163   * @throws NullPointerException
164   *           If {@code jsonMapper} or {@code webRequestor} is {@code null}.
165   * @since 1.6.14
166   */
167  public DefaultFacebookClient(String accessToken, WebRequestor webRequestor, JsonMapper jsonMapper,
168      Version apiVersion) {
169    this(accessToken, null, webRequestor, jsonMapper, apiVersion);
170  }
171
172  /**
173   * Creates a Facebook Graph API client with the given {@code accessToken}, {@code webRequestor}, and
174   * {@code jsonMapper}.
175   * 
176   * @param accessToken
177   *          A Facebook OAuth access token.
178   * @param appSecret
179   *          A Facebook application secret.
180   * @param webRequestor
181   *          The {@link WebRequestor} implementation to use for sending requests to the API endpoint.
182   * @param jsonMapper
183   *          The {@link JsonMapper} implementation to use for mapping API response JSON to Java objects.
184   * @param apiVersion
185   *          Version of the api endpoint
186   * @throws NullPointerException
187   *           If {@code jsonMapper} or {@code webRequestor} is {@code null}.
188   */
189  public DefaultFacebookClient(String accessToken, String appSecret, WebRequestor webRequestor, JsonMapper jsonMapper,
190      Version apiVersion) {
191    super();
192
193    verifyParameterPresence("jsonMapper", jsonMapper);
194    verifyParameterPresence("webRequestor", webRequestor);
195
196    this.accessToken = trimToNull(accessToken);
197    this.appSecret = trimToNull(appSecret);
198
199    this.webRequestor = webRequestor;
200    this.jsonMapper = jsonMapper;
201    this.jsonMapper.setFacebookClient(this);
202    this.apiVersion = Optional.ofNullable(apiVersion).orElse(Version.UNVERSIONED);
203    graphFacebookExceptionGenerator = new DefaultFacebookExceptionGenerator();
204  }
205
206  /**
207   * Switch between access token in header and access token in query parameters (default)
208   * 
209   * @param accessTokenInHttpHeader
210   *          <code>true</code> use access token as header field, <code>false</code> use access token as query parameter
211   *          (default)
212   */
213  public void setHeaderAuthorization(boolean accessTokenInHttpHeader) {
214    this.accessTokenInHeader = accessTokenInHttpHeader;
215  }
216
217  /**
218   * override the default facebook exception generator to provide a custom handling for the facebook error objects
219   * 
220   * @param exceptionGenerator
221   *          the custom exception generator implementing the {@link FacebookExceptionGenerator} interface
222   */
223  public void setFacebookExceptionGenerator(FacebookExceptionGenerator exceptionGenerator) {
224    graphFacebookExceptionGenerator = exceptionGenerator;
225  }
226
227  /**
228   * fetch the current facebook exception generator implementing the {@link FacebookExceptionGenerator} interface
229   * 
230   * @return the current facebook exception generator
231   */
232  public FacebookExceptionGenerator getFacebookExceptionGenerator() {
233    return graphFacebookExceptionGenerator;
234  }
235
236  @Override
237  public boolean deleteObject(String object, Parameter... parameters) {
238    verifyParameterPresence("object", object);
239
240    String responseString = makeRequest(object, true, true, null, parameters);
241
242    try {
243      JsonValue jObj = Json.parse(responseString);
244      boolean success = false;
245      if (jObj.isObject()) {
246        if (jObj.asObject().contains("success")) {
247          success = jObj.asObject().get("success").asBoolean();
248        }
249        if (jObj.asObject().contains("result")) {
250          success = jObj.asObject().get("result").asString().contains("Successfully deleted");
251        }
252      } else {
253        success = jObj.asBoolean();
254      }
255      return success;
256    } catch (ParseException jex) {
257      CLIENT_LOGGER.trace("no valid JSON returned while deleting a object, using returned String instead", jex);
258      return "true".equals(responseString);
259    }
260  }
261
262  /**
263   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#fetchConnection(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.Parameter[])
264   */
265  @Override
266  public <T> Connection<T> fetchConnection(String connection, Class<T> connectionType, Parameter... parameters) {
267    verifyParameterPresence(CONNECTION, connection);
268    verifyParameterPresence(CONNECTION_TYPE, connectionType);
269    return new Connection<>(this, makeRequest(connection, parameters), connectionType);
270  }
271
272  /**
273   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#fetchConnectionPage(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class)
274   */
275  @Override
276  public <T> Connection<T> fetchConnectionPage(final String connectionPageUrl, Class<T> connectionType) {
277    String connectionJson;
278    if (!isBlank(accessToken) && !isBlank(appSecret)) {
279      WebRequestor.Request request = new WebRequestor.Request(String.format("%s&%s=%s", connectionPageUrl,
280        urlEncode(APP_SECRET_PROOF_PARAM_NAME), obtainAppSecretProof(accessToken, appSecret)), null);
281      connectionJson = makeRequestAndProcessResponse(() -> webRequestor.executeGet(request));
282    } else {
283      connectionJson = makeRequestAndProcessResponse(
284        () -> webRequestor.executeGet(new WebRequestor.Request(connectionPageUrl, getHeaderAccessToken())));
285    }
286
287    return new Connection<>(this, connectionJson, connectionType);
288  }
289
290  /**
291   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#fetchObject(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.Parameter[])
292   */
293  @Override
294  public <T> T fetchObject(String object, Class<T> objectType, Parameter... parameters) {
295    verifyParameterPresence("object", object);
296    verifyParameterPresence("objectType", objectType);
297    return jsonMapper.toJavaObject(makeRequest(object, parameters), objectType);
298  }
299
300  @Override
301  public FacebookClient createClientWithAccessToken(String accessToken) {
302    return new DefaultFacebookClient(accessToken, this.appSecret, this.apiVersion);
303  }
304
305  /**
306   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#fetchObjects(java.util.List, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.Parameter[])
307   */
308  @Override
309  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
310  public <T> T fetchObjects(List<String> ids, Class<T> objectType, Parameter... parameters) {
311    verifyParameterPresence("ids", ids);
312    verifyParameterPresence(CONNECTION_TYPE, objectType);
313    requireNotEmpty(ids, "The list of IDs cannot be empty.");
314
315    if (Stream.of(parameters).anyMatch(p -> IDS_PARAM_NAME.equals(p.name))) {
316      throw new IllegalArgumentException("You cannot specify the '" + IDS_PARAM_NAME + "' URL parameter yourself - "
317          + "RestFB will populate this for you with the list of IDs you passed to this method.");
318    }
319
320    JsonArray idArray = new JsonArray();
321
322    // Normalize the IDs
323    for (String id : ids) {
324      throwIAEonBlankId(id);
325      idArray.add(id.trim());
326    }
327
328    try {
329      String jsonString = makeRequest("",
330        parametersWithAdditionalParameter(Parameter.with(IDS_PARAM_NAME, idArray.toString()), parameters));
331
332      return jsonMapper.toJavaObject(jsonString, objectType);
333    } catch (ParseException e) {
334      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("Unable to map connection JSON to Java objects", e);
335    }
336  }
337
338  private void throwIAEonBlankId(String id) {
339    if (StringUtils.isBlank(id)) {
340      throw new IllegalArgumentException("The list of IDs cannot contain blank strings.");
341    }
342  }
343
344  /**
345   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#publish(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.BinaryAttachment,
346   *      com.restfb.Parameter[])
347   */
348  @Override
349  public <T> T publish(String connection, Class<T> objectType, List<BinaryAttachment> binaryAttachments,
350      Parameter... parameters) {
351    verifyParameterPresence(CONNECTION, connection);
352
353    return jsonMapper.toJavaObject(makeRequest(connection, true, false, binaryAttachments, parameters), objectType);
354  }
355
356  /**
357   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#publish(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.BinaryAttachment,
358   *      com.restfb.Parameter[])
359   */
360  @Override
361  public <T> T publish(String connection, Class<T> objectType, BinaryAttachment binaryAttachment,
362      Parameter... parameters) {
363    List<BinaryAttachment> attachments =
364        Optional.ofNullable(binaryAttachment).map(Collections::singletonList).orElse(null);
365    return publish(connection, objectType, attachments, parameters);
366  }
367
368  /**
369   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#publish(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.Parameter[])
370   */
371  @Override
372  public <T> T publish(String connection, Class<T> objectType, Parameter... parameters) {
373    return publish(connection, objectType, (List<BinaryAttachment>) null, parameters);
374  }
375
376  @Override
377  public <T> T publish(String connection, Class<T> objectType, Body body, Parameter... parameters) {
378    verifyParameterPresence(CONNECTION, connection);
379    return jsonMapper.toJavaObject(makeRequest(connection, true, false, null, body, parameters), objectType);
380  }
381
382  @Override
383  public String getLogoutUrl(String next) {
384    String parameterString;
385    if (next != null) {
386      Parameter p = Parameter.with("next", next);
387      parameterString = toParameterString(false, p);
388    } else {
389      parameterString = toParameterString(false);
390    }
391
392    final String fullEndPoint = createEndpointForApiCall("logout.php", false);
393    return fullEndPoint + "?" + parameterString;
394  }
395
396  /**
397   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#executeBatch(com.restfb.batch.BatchRequest[])
398   */
399  @Override
400  public List<BatchResponse> executeBatch(BatchRequest... batchRequests) {
401    return executeBatch(asList(batchRequests), Collections.emptyList());
402  }
403
404  /**
405   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#executeBatch(java.util.List)
406   */
407  @Override
408  public List<BatchResponse> executeBatch(List<BatchRequest> batchRequests) {
409    return executeBatch(batchRequests, Collections.emptyList());
410  }
411
412  /**
413   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#executeBatch(java.util.List, java.util.List)
414   */
415  @Override
416  public List<BatchResponse> executeBatch(List<BatchRequest> batchRequests, List<BinaryAttachment> binaryAttachments) {
417    verifyParameterPresence("binaryAttachments", binaryAttachments);
418    requireNotEmpty(batchRequests, "You must specify at least one batch request.");
419
420    return jsonMapper.toJavaList(
421      makeRequest("", true, false, binaryAttachments, Parameter.with("batch", jsonMapper.toJson(batchRequests, true))),
422      BatchResponse.class);
423  }
424
425  /**
426   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#convertSessionKeysToAccessTokens(java.lang.String, java.lang.String,
427   *      java.lang.String[])
428   */
429  @Override
430  public List<AccessToken> convertSessionKeysToAccessTokens(String appId, String secretKey, String... sessionKeys) {
431    verifyParameterPresence(APP_ID, appId);
432    verifyParameterPresence("secretKey", secretKey);
433
434    if (sessionKeys == null || sessionKeys.length == 0) {
435      return emptyList();
436    }
437
438    String json = makeRequest("/oauth/exchange_sessions", true, false, null, Parameter.with(CLIENT_ID, appId),
439      Parameter.with(PARAM_CLIENT_SECRET, secretKey), Parameter.with("sessions", String.join(",", sessionKeys)));
440
441    return jsonMapper.toJavaList(json, AccessToken.class);
442  }
443
444  /**
445   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#obtainAppAccessToken(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
446   */
447  @Override
448  public AccessToken obtainAppAccessToken(String appId, String appSecret) {
449    verifyParameterPresence(APP_ID, appId);
450    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
451
452    String response = makeRequest("oauth/access_token", Parameter.with("grant_type", "client_credentials"),
453      Parameter.with(CLIENT_ID, appId), Parameter.with(PARAM_CLIENT_SECRET, appSecret));
454
455    try {
456      return getAccessTokenFromResponse(response);
457    } catch (Exception t) {
458      throw new FacebookResponseContentException(CANNOT_EXTRACT_ACCESS_TOKEN_MESSAGE, t);
459    }
460  }
461
462  @Override
463  public DeviceCode fetchDeviceCode(ScopeBuilder scope) {
464    verifyParameterPresence(SCOPE, scope);
465    ObjectUtil.requireNotNull(accessToken,
466      () -> new IllegalStateException("access token is required to fetch a device access token"));
467
468    String response = makeRequest("device/login", true, false, null, Parameter.with("type", "device_code"),
469      Parameter.with(SCOPE, scope.toString()));
470    return jsonMapper.toJavaObject(response, DeviceCode.class);
471  }
472
473  @Override
474  public AccessToken obtainDeviceAccessToken(String code) throws FacebookDeviceTokenCodeExpiredException,
475      FacebookDeviceTokenPendingException, FacebookDeviceTokenDeclinedException, FacebookDeviceTokenSlowdownException {
476    verifyParameterPresence("code", code);
477
478    ObjectUtil.requireNotNull(accessToken,
479      () -> new IllegalStateException("access token is required to fetch a device access token"));
480
481    try {
482      String response = makeRequest("device/login_status", true, false, null, Parameter.with("type", "device_token"),
483        Parameter.with("code", code));
484      return getAccessTokenFromResponse(response);
485    } catch (FacebookOAuthException foae) {
486      DeviceTokenExceptionFactory.createFrom(foae);
487      return null;
488    }
489  }
490
491  /**
492   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#obtainUserAccessToken(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String,
493   *      java.lang.String)
494   */
495  @Override
496  public AccessToken obtainUserAccessToken(String appId, String appSecret, String redirectUri,
497      String verificationCode) {
498    verifyParameterPresence(APP_ID, appId);
499    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
500    verifyParameterPresence("verificationCode", verificationCode);
501
502    String response = makeRequest("oauth/access_token", Parameter.with(CLIENT_ID, appId),
503      Parameter.with(PARAM_CLIENT_SECRET, appSecret), Parameter.with("code", verificationCode),
504      Parameter.with("redirect_uri", redirectUri));
505
506    try {
507      return getAccessTokenFromResponse(response);
508    } catch (Exception t) {
509      throw new FacebookResponseContentException(CANNOT_EXTRACT_ACCESS_TOKEN_MESSAGE, t);
510    }
511  }
512
513  /**
514   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#obtainExtendedAccessToken(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
515   */
516  @Override
517  public AccessToken obtainExtendedAccessToken(String appId, String appSecret) {
518    ObjectUtil.requireNotNull(accessToken,
519      () -> new IllegalStateException(
520        format("You cannot call this method because you did not construct this instance of %s with an access token.",
521          getClass().getSimpleName())));
522
523    return obtainExtendedAccessToken(appId, appSecret, accessToken);
524  }
525
526  /**
527   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#obtainExtendedAccessToken(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
528   */
529  @Override
530  public AccessToken obtainExtendedAccessToken(String appId, String appSecret, String accessToken) {
531    verifyParameterPresence(APP_ID, appId);
532    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
533    verifyParameterPresence("accessToken", accessToken);
534
535    String response = makeRequest("/oauth/access_token", false, false, null, Parameter.with(CLIENT_ID, appId),
536      Parameter.with(PARAM_CLIENT_SECRET, appSecret), Parameter.with("grant_type", "fb_exchange_token"),
537      Parameter.with("fb_exchange_token", accessToken));
538
539    try {
540      return getAccessTokenFromResponse(response);
541    } catch (Exception t) {
542      throw new FacebookResponseContentException(CANNOT_EXTRACT_ACCESS_TOKEN_MESSAGE, t);
543    }
544  }
545
546  private AccessToken getAccessTokenFromResponse(String response) {
547    AccessToken token;
548    try {
549      token = getJsonMapper().toJavaObject(response, AccessToken.class);
550    } catch (FacebookJsonMappingException fjme) {
551      CLIENT_LOGGER.trace("could not map response to access token class try to fetch directly from String", fjme);
552      token = AccessToken.fromQueryString(response);
553    }
554    token.setClient(createClientWithAccessToken(token.getAccessToken()));
555    return token;
556  }
557
558  @Override
559  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
560  public <T> T parseSignedRequest(String signedRequest, String appSecret, Class<T> objectType) {
561    verifyParameterPresence("signedRequest", signedRequest);
562    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
563    verifyParameterPresence("objectType", objectType);
564
565    String[] signedRequestTokens = signedRequest.split("[.]");
566
567    if (signedRequestTokens.length != 2) {
568      throw new FacebookSignedRequestParsingException(format(
569        "Signed request '%s' is expected to be signature and payload strings separated by a '.'", signedRequest));
570    }
571
572    String encodedSignature = signedRequestTokens[0];
573    String urlDecodedSignature = urlDecodeSignedRequestToken(encodedSignature);
574    byte[] signature = decodeBase64(urlDecodedSignature);
575
576    String encodedPayload = signedRequestTokens[1];
577    String urlDecodedPayload = urlDecodeSignedRequestToken(encodedPayload);
578    String payload = StringUtils.toString(decodeBase64(urlDecodedPayload));
579
580    // Convert payload to a JsonObject so we can pull algorithm data out of it
581    JsonObject payloadObject = getJsonMapper().toJavaObject(payload, JsonObject.class);
582
583    if (!payloadObject.contains(ALGORITHM)) {
584      throw new FacebookSignedRequestParsingException("Unable to detect algorithm used for signed request");
585    }
586
587    String algorithm = payloadObject.getString(ALGORITHM, null);
588
589    if (!verifySignedRequest(appSecret, algorithm, encodedPayload, signature)) {
590      throw new FacebookSignedRequestVerificationException(
591        "Signed request verification failed. Are you sure the request was made for the app identified by the app secret you provided?");
592    }
593
594    // Marshal to the user's preferred type.
595    // If the user asked for a JsonObject, send back the one we already parsed.
596    return objectType.equals(JsonObject.class) ? (T) payloadObject : getJsonMapper().toJavaObject(payload, objectType);
597  }
598
599  /**
600   * Decodes a component of a signed request received from Facebook using FB's special URL-encoding strategy.
601   * 
602   * @param signedRequestToken
603   *          Token to decode.
604   * @return The decoded token.
605   */
606  protected String urlDecodeSignedRequestToken(String signedRequestToken) {
607    verifyParameterPresence("signedRequestToken", signedRequestToken);
608    return signedRequestToken.replace("-", "+").replace("_", "/").trim();
609  }
610
611  @Override
612  public String getLoginDialogUrl(String appId, String redirectUri, ScopeBuilder scope, Parameter... parameters) {
613    verifyParameterPresence(APP_ID, appId);
614    verifyParameterPresence("redirectUri", redirectUri);
615    verifyParameterPresence(SCOPE, scope);
616
617    String dialogUrl = getFacebookEndpointUrls().getFacebookEndpoint() + "/dialog/oauth";
618
619    List<Parameter> parameterList = new ArrayList<>();
620    parameterList.add(Parameter.with(CLIENT_ID, appId));
621    parameterList.add(Parameter.with("redirect_uri", redirectUri));
622    parameterList.add(Parameter.with(SCOPE, scope.toString()));
623
624    // add optional parameters
625    Collections.addAll(parameterList, parameters);
626
627    return dialogUrl + "?" + toParameterString(false, parameterList.toArray(new Parameter[0]));
628  }
629
630  /**
631   * Verifies that the signed request is really from Facebook.
632   * 
633   * @param appSecret
634   *          The secret for the app that can verify this signed request.
635   * @param algorithm
636   *          Signature algorithm specified by FB in the decoded payload.
637   * @param encodedPayload
638   *          The encoded payload used to generate a signature for comparison against the provided {@code signature}.
639   * @param signature
640   *          The decoded signature extracted from the signed request. Compared against a signature generated from
641   *          {@code encodedPayload}.
642   * @return {@code true} if the signed request is verified, {@code false} if not.
643   */
644  protected boolean verifySignedRequest(String appSecret, String algorithm, String encodedPayload, byte[] signature) {
645    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
646    verifyParameterPresence(ALGORITHM, algorithm);
647    verifyParameterPresence("encodedPayload", encodedPayload);
648    verifyParameterPresence("signature", signature);
649
650    // Normalize algorithm name...FB calls it differently than Java does
651    if ("HMAC-SHA256".equalsIgnoreCase(algorithm)) {
652      algorithm = "HMACSHA256";
653    }
654
655    try {
656      Mac mac = Mac.getInstance(algorithm);
657      mac.init(new SecretKeySpec(toBytes(appSecret), algorithm));
658      byte[] payloadSignature = mac.doFinal(toBytes(encodedPayload));
659      return Arrays.equals(signature, payloadSignature);
660    } catch (Exception e) {
661      throw new FacebookSignedRequestVerificationException("Unable to perform signed request verification", e);
662    }
663  }
664
665  /**
666   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#debugToken(java.lang.String)
667   */
668  @Override
669  public DebugTokenInfo debugToken(String inputToken) {
670    verifyParameterPresence("inputToken", inputToken);
671    String response = makeRequest("/debug_token", Parameter.with("input_token", inputToken));
672
673    try {
674      JsonObject json = Json.parse(response).asObject();
675      JsonObject data = json.get("data").asObject();
676      return getJsonMapper().toJavaObject(data.toString(), DebugTokenInfo.class);
677    } catch (Exception t) {
678      throw new FacebookResponseContentException("Unable to parse JSON from response.", t);
679    }
680  }
681
682  /**
683   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#getJsonMapper()
684   */
685  @Override
686  public JsonMapper getJsonMapper() {
687    return jsonMapper;
688  }
689
690  /**
691   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#getWebRequestor()
692   */
693  @Override
694  public WebRequestor getWebRequestor() {
695    return webRequestor;
696  }
697
698  /**
699   * Coordinates the process of executing the API request GET/POST and processing the response we receive from the
700   * endpoint.
701   * 
702   * @param endpoint
703   *          Facebook Graph API endpoint.
704   * @param parameters
705   *          Arbitrary number of parameters to send along to Facebook as part of the API call.
706   * @return The JSON returned by Facebook for the API call.
707   * @throws FacebookException
708   *           If an error occurs while making the Facebook API POST or processing the response.
709   */
710  protected String makeRequest(String endpoint, Parameter... parameters) {
711    return makeRequest(endpoint, false, false, null, parameters);
712  }
713
714  protected String makeRequest(String endpoint, final boolean executeAsPost, final boolean executeAsDelete,
715      final List<BinaryAttachment> binaryAttachments, Parameter... parameters) {
716    return makeRequest(endpoint, executeAsPost, executeAsDelete,
717    binaryAttachments, null, parameters);
718  }
719
720  /**
721   * Coordinates the process of executing the API request GET/POST and processing the response we receive from the
722   * endpoint.
723   * 
724   * @param endpoint
725   *          Facebook Graph API endpoint.
726   * @param executeAsPost
727   *          {@code true} to execute the web request as a {@code POST}, {@code false} to execute as a {@code GET}.
728   * @param executeAsDelete
729   *          {@code true} to add a special 'treat this request as a {@code DELETE}' parameter.
730   * @param binaryAttachments
731   *          A list of binary files to include in a {@code POST} request. Pass {@code null} if no attachment should be
732   *          sent.
733   * @param parameters
734   *          Arbitrary number of parameters to send along to Facebook as part of the API call.
735   * @return The JSON returned by Facebook for the API call.
736   * @throws FacebookException
737   *           If an error occurs while making the Facebook API POST or processing the response.
738   */
739  protected String makeRequest(String endpoint, final boolean executeAsPost, final boolean executeAsDelete,
740      final List<BinaryAttachment> binaryAttachments, Body body, Parameter... parameters) {
741    verifyParameterLegality(parameters);
742
743    if (executeAsDelete && isHttpDeleteFallback()) {
744      parameters = parametersWithAdditionalParameter(Parameter.with(METHOD_PARAM_NAME, "delete"), parameters);
745    }
746
747    if (!endpoint.startsWith("/")) {
748      endpoint = "/" + endpoint;
749    }
750
751    final String fullEndpoint =
752        createEndpointForApiCall(endpoint, binaryAttachments != null && !binaryAttachments.isEmpty());
753    final String parameterString = toParameterString(parameters);
754
755    return makeRequestAndProcessResponse(() -> {
756      WebRequestor.Request request = new WebRequestor.Request(fullEndpoint, getHeaderAccessToken(), parameterString);
757      if (executeAsDelete && !isHttpDeleteFallback()) {
758        return webRequestor.executeDelete(request);
759      }
760
761      if (executeAsPost) {
762        request.setBinaryAttachments(binaryAttachments);
763        request.setBody(body);
764        return webRequestor.executePost(request);
765      }
766
767      return webRequestor.executeGet(request);
768    });
769  }
770
771  private String getHeaderAccessToken() {
772    if (accessTokenInHeader) {
773      return this.accessToken;
774    }
775
776    return null;
777  }
778
779  /**
780   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#obtainAppSecretProof(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
781   */
782  @Override
783  public String obtainAppSecretProof(String accessToken, String appSecret) {
784    verifyParameterPresence("accessToken", accessToken);
785    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
786    return EncodingUtils.encodeAppSecretProof(appSecret, accessToken);
787  }
788
789  /**
790   * returns if the fallback post method (<code>true</code>) is used or the http delete (<code>false</code>)
791   * 
792   * @return {@code true} if POST is used instead of HTTP DELETE (default)
793   */
794  public boolean isHttpDeleteFallback() {
795    return httpDeleteFallback;
796  }
797
798  /**
799   * Set to <code>true</code> if the facebook http delete fallback should be used. Facebook allows to use the http POST
800   * with the parameter "method=delete" to override the post and use delete instead. This feature allow http client that
801   * do not support the whole http method set, to delete objects from facebook
802   * 
803   * @param httpDeleteFallback
804   *          <code>true</code> if the the http Delete Fallback is used
805   */
806  public void setHttpDeleteFallback(boolean httpDeleteFallback) {
807    this.httpDeleteFallback = httpDeleteFallback;
808  }
809
810  protected interface Requestor {
811    Response makeRequest() throws IOException;
812  }
813
814  protected String makeRequestAndProcessResponse(Requestor requestor) {
815    Response response;
816
817    // Perform a GET or POST to the API endpoint
818    try {
819      response = requestor.makeRequest();
820    } catch (Exception t) {
821      throw new FacebookNetworkException(t);
822    }
823
824    // If we get any HTTP response code other than a 200 OK or 400 Bad Request
825    // or 401 Not Authorized or 403 Forbidden or 404 Not Found or 500 Internal
826    // Server Error or 302 Not Modified
827    // throw an exception.
828    if (HTTP_OK != response.getStatusCode() && HTTP_BAD_REQUEST != response.getStatusCode()
829        && HTTP_UNAUTHORIZED != response.getStatusCode() && HTTP_NOT_FOUND != response.getStatusCode()
830        && HTTP_INTERNAL_ERROR != response.getStatusCode() && HTTP_FORBIDDEN != response.getStatusCode()
831        && HTTP_NOT_MODIFIED != response.getStatusCode()) {
832      throw new FacebookNetworkException(response.getStatusCode());
833    }
834
835    String json = response.getBody();
836
837    try {
838      // If the response contained an error code, throw an exception.
839      getFacebookExceptionGenerator().throwFacebookResponseStatusExceptionIfNecessary(json, response.getStatusCode());
840    } catch (FacebookErrorMessageException feme) {
841      Optional.ofNullable(getWebRequestor()).map(WebRequestor::getDebugHeaderInfo).ifPresent(feme::setDebugHeaderInfo);
842      throw feme;
843    }
844
845    // If there was no response error information and this was a 500 or 401
846    // error, something weird happened on Facebook's end. Bail.
847    if (HTTP_INTERNAL_ERROR == response.getStatusCode() || HTTP_UNAUTHORIZED == response.getStatusCode()) {
848      throw new FacebookNetworkException(response.getStatusCode());
849    }
850
851    return json;
852  }
853
854  /**
855   * Generate the parameter string to be included in the Facebook API request.
856   * 
857   * @param parameters
858   *          Arbitrary number of extra parameters to include in the request.
859   * @return The parameter string to include in the Facebook API request.
860   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
861   *           If an error occurs when building the parameter string.
862   */
863  protected String toParameterString(Parameter... parameters) {
864    return toParameterString(true, parameters);
865  }
866
867  /**
868   * Generate the parameter string to be included in the Facebook API request.
869   * 
870   * @param withJsonParameter
871   *          add additional parameter format with type json
872   * @param parameters
873   *          Arbitrary number of extra parameters to include in the request.
874   * @return The parameter string to include in the Facebook API request.
875   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
876   *           If an error occurs when building the parameter string.
877   */
878  protected String toParameterString(boolean withJsonParameter, Parameter... parameters) {
879    if (!isBlank(accessToken) && !accessTokenInHeader) {
880      parameters = parametersWithAdditionalParameter(Parameter.with(ACCESS_TOKEN_PARAM_NAME, accessToken), parameters);
881    }
882
883    if (!isBlank(accessToken) && !isBlank(appSecret)) {
884      parameters = parametersWithAdditionalParameter(
885        Parameter.with(APP_SECRET_PROOF_PARAM_NAME, obtainAppSecretProof(accessToken, appSecret)), parameters);
886    }
887
888    if (withJsonParameter) {
889      parameters = parametersWithAdditionalParameter(Parameter.with(FORMAT_PARAM_NAME, "json"), parameters);
890    }
891
892    return Stream.of(parameters).map(p -> urlEncode(p.name) + "=" + urlEncodedValueForParameterName(p.name, p.value))
893      .collect(Collectors.joining("&"));
894  }
895
896  /**
897   * @see com.restfb.BaseFacebookClient#createEndpointForApiCall(java.lang.String,boolean)
898   */
899  @Override
900  protected String createEndpointForApiCall(String apiCall, boolean hasAttachment) {
901    while (apiCall.startsWith("/"))
902      apiCall = apiCall.substring(1);
903
904    String baseUrl = getFacebookGraphEndpointUrl();
905
906    if (hasAttachment && (apiCall.endsWith("/videos") || apiCall.endsWith("/advideos"))) {
907      baseUrl = getFacebookGraphVideoEndpointUrl();
908    } else if (apiCall.endsWith("logout.php")) {
909      baseUrl = getFacebookEndpointUrls().getFacebookEndpoint();
910    }
911
912    return format("%s/%s", baseUrl, apiCall);
913  }
914
915  /**
916   * Returns the base endpoint URL for the Graph API.
917   * 
918   * @return The base endpoint URL for the Graph API.
919   */
920  protected String getFacebookGraphEndpointUrl() {
921    if (apiVersion.isUrlElementRequired()) {
922      return getFacebookEndpointUrls().getGraphEndpoint() + '/' + apiVersion.getUrlElement();
923    } else {
924      return getFacebookEndpointUrls().getGraphEndpoint();
925    }
926  }
927
928  /**
929   * Returns the base endpoint URL for the Graph API's video upload functionality.
930   * 
931   * @return The base endpoint URL for the Graph API's video upload functionality.
932   * @since 1.6.5
933   */
934  protected String getFacebookGraphVideoEndpointUrl() {
935    if (apiVersion.isUrlElementRequired()) {
936      return getFacebookEndpointUrls().getGraphVideoEndpoint() + '/' + apiVersion.getUrlElement();
937    } else {
938      return getFacebookEndpointUrls().getGraphVideoEndpoint();
939    }
940  }
941
942  public FacebookEndpoints getFacebookEndpointUrls() {
943    return facebookEndpointUrls;
944  }
945
946  public void setFacebookEndpointUrls(FacebookEndpoints facebookEndpointUrls) {
947    this.facebookEndpointUrls = facebookEndpointUrls;
948  }
949}
